replies.bodyText: I will update this but wonder if it does make any sense to set the first version to a pre 1.0 release, shouldn’t we update all the first version to 1.0 once we release it ?
replies.author: lburgazzoli

replies.bodyText: Yes they should all be 1.0.0 when its GA. All older versions are EOL and dead. And those M2, RC2, RC3 versions dont add value but just more confusion.
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: It is still practical to be able to tell (for a tweet and/or blog post) what's new in 1.0.0 compared to CR2 for the users who know/use CR2.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: So I'd vote for consistently using the CR3 label for the newest stuff until shortly before the release and eliminate all labels when releasing.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: I think no one is questioning about having CR3 here now but the question was about what we should do when we'll release 1.0
replies.author: lburgazzoli

replies.bodyText: Yes, changing all firstVersions to 1.0.0 is a good idea. Sorry that I have not expressed that straight away.
replies.author: ppalaga
